thread.title: Kansas picked to win Big 12 basketball title
thread.title_full: Kansas picked to win Big 12 basketball title

author: The Capital-Journal
title: Kansas picked to win Big 12 basketball title
text:
Kansas picked to win Big 12 basketball title K-State tied for eighth in preseason ballot Posted: October 15, 2015 - 9:48am By The Capital-Journal 
The Kansas men's basketball team is the unanimous pick to win the Big 12 conference. 
The Jayhawks received nine first-place votes in the conference coaches' poll released Thursday for 81 points, topping second-place Oklahoma, which had 70 points. 
Coaches are not allowed to vote for their own teams in the rankings. 
KU coach Bill Self gave his first-place vote to Iowa State, which was third with 68 points. Texas (51) and Baylor (49) rounded out the top five. 
Kansas State (18 points) was picked to finish in a tie for eighth with TCU. The Wildcats were preseason picked to finish fourth in last year's poll. 
KU is in pursuit of its 12th straight league title under Self. The Jayhawks have been picked to win the conference in the coaches poll in six of the last seven seasons. 
2015-16 Big 12 men's basketball coaches poll 
1. Kansas (9) 81 
3. Iowa State (1) 68 
4. Texas 51
